abstract: Former Argentine transportation ministers Juan Pablo Schiavi and Ricardo Jaime are convicted along with 19 others for their roles in 2012 Buenos Aires commuter train crash that killed 51 people.
lead_paragraph: Juan Pablo Schiavi, who held the post at the time, was given an eight-year sentence, convicted of causing the deaths of 51 people in a 2012 train crash in Buenos Aires.

headline.print_headline: The Americas; Argentina: Ex-Transportation Ministers Get Prison

snippet: Juan Pablo Schiavi, who held the post at the time, was given an eight-year sentence, convicted of causing the deaths of 51 people in a 2012 train crash in Buenos Aires.
